thread.title: Amp for retro gaming...
thread.title_full: Amp for retro gaming... | Overclockers UK Forums

posts.author: Housey
posts.title: Amp for retro gaming...
posts.text:
I have started to build out a gaming section for my retro stuff, a work in progress. It's neither flash or high end, but I do have the need to plug many devices into 1 source and then route that to a TV and some speakers. I am perhaps looking at something older here as ideally I would like something that can take HDMI, SCART, SVIDEO, Digital and Composite inputs in volume, then fire them out maybe via HDMI, SCART and SVIDEO into my Framemeister, whilst transferring the sound to a pair of speakers too!
So, what can I do, am I on a road to nowhere? Budget is what it needs to be but cheaper the better and perfectly happy to go old school (read 2nd hand) if needs be.

thread.title: Muhammed Chaudhry Joins ConnecPath as Advisor
thread.title_full: Muhammed Chaudhry Joins ConnecPath as Advisor - PR.com

posts.author: PR.com
posts.title: Muhammed Chaudhry Joins ConnecPath as Advisor
posts.text:
Muhammed Chaudhry Joins ConnecPath as Advisor
ConnecPath, Inc. (ConnecPath) announced today that education champion Muhammed Chaudhry has joined them as an advisor.
Milpitas, CA, December 07, 2017 --( PR.com )-- Chaudhry is a leader in changing the way people think about education. As president and CEO of the Silicon Valley Education Foundation (“SVEF”), he revolutionized the way people understand and respond to the critical need of improving schools to create the next generation of innovators and business leaders.
Under Mr. Chaudhry’s leadership, SVEF became the go-to education foundation supporting students, teachers, and families throughout Silicon Valley and beyond. The foundation’s signature program, Elevate Math, has partnered with 45 school districts and involved 11,500 students, not only in Silicon Valley, but also in Oakland, Sacramento and Oregon. Mr. Chaudhry and the SVEF foundation remain focused on new and innovative ways for students to learn while closing the achievement gap - especially for under-represented and minority students.
For much of his career, Mr. Chaudhry has immersed himself in educational causes, looking to unite the business, technology, and academic communities to advance those causes. After completing his undergraduate degree in business, Mr. Chaudhry worked in the private sector as a brand marketer with the Clorox Company and Dazzle Multimedia. Despite private sector success, Mr. Chaudhry’s passion for philanthropy, and for causes that touched children’s lives, drew him back to the non-profit sector.
Mr. Chaudhry joined SVEF in 2001, and spent the next 16 years placing SVEF on the map by forging successful partnerships with world leading firms including Oracle, Cisco, Google, HP, SAP, Target, and Walmart. Since 2008 Mr. Chaudhry has raised over $100 million for numerous education initiatives.
Under Mr. Chaudhry’s leadership, SVEF developed successful math and science support programs, which improved the skills and performance of more than 10,000 students. These programs have become a national model. Notably, Mr. Chaudhry led efforts to create SVEF’s Innovation Learning Hub (“iHub”), designed to align education software developers and classroom teachers to test the best products. In partnership with the San Francisco 49ers, Mr. Chaudhry also helped create the 49ers STEM Leadership Institute - which annually exposes 60 high-performing middle school students to a top-level program in STEM education.
About ConnecPath Inc.
ConnecPath is an ed-tech company revolutionizing how students build education and career pathways. Students have historically had to make important decisions about college and careers independently and with limited information. No longer. ConnecPath’s next-generation collaboration platform brings the power of artificial intelligence to students and educators, putting an end to that uncomfortable journey. With ConnecPath, students find pathways that fit their individual passions and competencies with amazing speed. ConnecPath was founded in September 2017 and is headquartered in Silicon Valley.

thread.title: Amp for retro gaming...
thread.title_full: Amp for retro gaming... | Overclockers UK Forums

posts.author: lucid
posts.text:
For what you need the older AV receivers that included HDMI as well as Component / S-Video / composite video and a whole raft of goodies with video cross-conversion (format to format) as well as up-conversion (SD to HD) would be right up your street. As others have said, AV receivers don't have SCART sockets - they just take up too much room for a start - but with adapters and converters it's possible to handle SCART's version of composite video and even RGBs converted to Component.
I've got a Yamaha RX-V1800 sitting in a box unused at the moment. This ex-£1000 receiver is hugely powerful (130W) which means it can handle pretty much any speakers you throw at it. You could have lots of fun with some big inexpensive floorstanders Middlewich Staffordshire Middlewich Staffordshire Hmm

thread.title: Amp for retro gaming...
thread.title_full: Amp for retro gaming... | Overclockers UK Forums

posts.author: barmyllama
posts.text:
I use a modern AV receiver, a Denon AX2300 for PC, modern and retro consoles. PC and modern consoles I just use HDMI. For retro I have them connected to an AV SCART switch box to my CRT TV. I then run stereo RCA cable from TV to AV receiver.
So basically you run the stereo RCA OUT from your TV to the stereo RCA in on the AV receiver.
As said, you can pick up decent used AV receivers for less than £100.

posts.author: Indu (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: Innovaccer Interview Questions [Technical & HR] For Freshers And Experienced
posts.text: Innovaccer Interview Questions [Technical & HR] For Freshers And Experienced Innovaccer Interview Questions Innovaccer is a healthcare company that provides you with many solutions regarding physician practices, hospitals, other healthcare systems and much more. Innovaccer is now hiring people for various positions. Here on this page, we are providing you with the necessary interview questions that will be useful for you. Check Here For Innovaccer Recruitment Innovaccer Interview Rounds In this company, you have openings for various domains. The interview process is same for almost all these positions. The interview process at Innovaccer is consisting of 4 rounds. They are Online Written exam Innovaccer Technical Interview Questions For Fresher’s Nursing Interview Questions Justify yourself as a nurse. How do you motivate patients? What do you find most difficult about being a nurse? How would you handle a patient who complains about everything? What motivates you to be a nurse? Why do you want to work with our hospital? What do you actually know about nursing? What do you do to keep current with medical findings and practices? Lab Technician Interview Questions Why pipetting training is crucial for a clinical technician? What is the salt content of blood plasma? Explain what is GLP? What are the common errors done by a technician while handling pipette? What is your knowledge of standard laboratory SOPs? What is the different sterilization methods used in the laboratory? Apart from technical work, what other duties you performed in a laboratory setting? Physiology Interview Questions What is the order of C-H bond length in C2H6 and C2H4 and C2H2? What are the drugs that cause blood brain barrier? How do you define the term Free Radicals? Draw the structure of Abscisic Acid? How do cytokinins occur? What is the bond angle? What is the bond angle in F-Xe-F? What are restriction maps? How are they useful? How do you say that a drug is bioequivalent with the other? How will you calculate the concentration of drugs in human plasma? Innovaccer HR Interview Questions For Fresher’s The hr round is the final round in the interview process where you have to make yourself exposed to the interviewer and convince him that you are the best one among all the others. Here are some interview questions that will help you out in this round. Tell me something about yourself that is not written in your resume. What do you know about us? Are you planning to go for further studies? What do you seek from a job? Explain how would be an asset to this organization? Assuming that you are selected, what will be your strategy for next 60 days? What have you learned from your failures? Why does this role interest you? Are you willing to relocate or travel? Have you been in some challenging situation? Explain how you handled it? What will you do if you are offered a job with a salary higher than this? What are the career options you have right now? What are your hobbies and interests? What do you want to achieve in the next 5 years? What do you do to improve your knowledge? Give me an example of your creativity. Innovaccer Technical Interview Questions For Experienced The technical interview is the first round of interview where you will meet your recruiter and have an interaction with. This is the time you can prove to him that you are technically sound and fit for the position he is going to recruit for. Here are some technical interview questions to help you in your interview. Graphic Designer Interview Questions Describe your creative process. What are the major steps? If you were asked to design a logo for our company what would it look like? How do you stay updated on the latest tools and trends? How do you prepare your work production? What kinds of design software you are familiar with? How do you work with collaborators like copywriters, developers, and project managers? How long would it take you to plan, design, and complete a 300×400 banner? What kind of design projects interest you? With what kind of print media you have worked? Let’s say someone tells you to design something without any context. What do you do? What is Linking Layer in Photoshop? What type of design work do you enjoy the most; print or digital? How do you find transitioning between the two? What have you done to improve your knowledge of graphic design? How do you adapt a brand for different audiences? How do you measure the success of your design? Security Engineer Interview Questions Explain the full process occurring when you go to a browser and visit a URL. Explain how SSL works. You find out that there is an active problem on your network. You can fix it, but it is out of your jurisdiction. What do you do? What is the Three-way handshake? How can it be used to create a DOS attack? How to secure data through NTFS Technique? Why would you want to use SSH from a Windows pc? What does it mean for a machine to have an “air gap”? Why are air gapped machines important? How do you protect your home Wireless Access Point? What is more important for cybersecurity professionals to focus on, threats or vulnerabilities? What are the common defenses against a Cross Site Scripting attack? Why are internal threats often times more successful than external threats? How would traceroute help you find out where a breakdown in communication is? Innovaccer HR Interview Questions For Experienced The hr round is more important for an experienced candidate because here he will be tested mostly for his managerial skills decision-making capabilities, planning and many more. Here are few interview questions to help you out in your hr interview. How does this position compare with others you’re applying for? What do you think is your greatest achievement? What was your biggest challenge with your previous boss? What motivates you to do a good job? I see, there’s some gap in your work history. Why? May I contact your past employer for a reference? How do you consider yourself successful? Are you happy with your career-to-date? What is your philosophy towards work? Have there been instances, when your decision was challenged by your colleague or manager? Why did you resign your previous job? Explain how would be an asset to this organization? If employed, how do you manage time for interviews? Hope this article is helpful to you in attending your interview at Innovaccer. Wish you a very good luck for your interview. For more job updates keep visiting our website All India Jobs regularly. Subscribe Here To Get Latest Freshers Jobs in India Note: After registration check your E-mail Immediately. Posted by Indu

posts.author: Synchronise
posts.text:
Re: A robot is the best chess player in the world after four hours of teaching itself
 Quote: : http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-42251535
AlphaZero , an AI engine created by DeepMind in London was given the rules of chess and played itself for four hours. After that it played 100 games against a world leading chess engine Stockfish 8 and won or drew every match (28/100 of the games were wins).
DeepMind AI engines have previously become masters of Space Invaders, Pong and the boardgame Go by training and improving over time. AlphaZero has been called "superhuman" because it was trained without the use of datasets derived from human expertise. AI is no longer constrained by the limits of human knowledge and the future possibilities are endless/scary.

posts.author: expedia.com
posts.text: Was a little apprehensive when reading previous reviews, but came on our vacation with an open mind. We had a ground level room and whereas the resort is older, our rooms were clean. Had a really nice maid, Christine, who really gave us great service. Her day off, however, no one showed to make up our room even after we requested it. Food was good, though, frequently not hot enough on the buffet, which was concerning and something they should work at. Specialty restaurants were generally good. Tepanyaki chief might have been new as he starting dishing up the meal early, so again, the food was somewhat lukewarm. Mexican restaurant had good guacamole and cerviche. Fish I ordered was a bit fishy tasting but I am pretty picky about seafood. It was nice having an adult pool with swim up bar. I enjoyed Natasha's water aerobics. She found some muscles I was unaware of. The wait staff was generally very friendly and accommodating and enjoyed interacting with them. Check in was very quick, but after I got home, I noticed that a $200 NOT $20 charge was put on my credit card. Pretty sure a typo and now hoping it will be corrected when they do the credit as we did not charge anything while there. The beach was nice though I got a few sand flea bites which typically happens in the Carribean. It was a bit windy during our stay with some intermittent rain but we still enjoyed plenty of sun and warmth. Would definitely stay here again.

posts.author: expedia.com
posts.text: We stayed at the Melia for 4 nights, with the all-inclusive package. We had an island view room, which faced the ocean a little which was nice, but it also faced the rundown hotel next door that was being worked on, but what can you do. For the hotel itself, the rooms were nice as well as the lobby. The layout to get to the rooms was a bit odd, you had to walk an entire U shape to get to your room which was a bit of a pain when our room was on the end. The day before we left, they were tearing up the pool bar and pool next to it. It probably would have been good if the hotel staff warned you it would be closed bc nobody knew. For the all-inclusive part, the food was mediocore. We didnt have anything amazing, and most of the time the food was cold which was a dissapointment. Half the food options need a reservation, and after trying the tapas bar (terrible) we decided to just stick to the buffet. We liked the breakfast - great spread and lots of options, as well as to-order omelettes and smoothies. Lunch was decent also, dinner was generally the most dissapointing for us. For alcohol, they use the cheap stuff but all usual mixed drinks, wines, and beers are included. If you want to pay extra, you can get premium alcohol or eat in the steakhouse. The biggest perk is the onsite beach, and the water activities included. Honestly, this is a very fairly priced all-inclusive and it was fine for us. I probably wouldn’t come back though, unless they improve the food.

posts.author: expedia.com
posts.text: Nov 30, 2017 The Level upgrade is worth the extra money. You get a private lounge that serves drinks and hor dourves all day for Level guests. Your all inclusives include premium liquor, more restaurants for all meals and a private beach area. You have a personal check in on the 4th floor but their lobby closes at 9. The resort itself is pretty quiet. They offer entertainment at night but it is not wild night life. There are not a lot of activities going on because it is a small resort. When I went, there was a schedule of activities for each day but they didn't always stick to it, I'm thinking because I went during off season so attendance was lower. I only ran into one disgruntled employee, otherwise the staff was friendly and helpful. They were making improvements and renovations because the building is a little run down but not that noticeably. They have extra water activities you can rent at the beach (or are free for The Level), such as kayaks, paddle boards, wake boards and jet skis (additional cost even for Level). They have both land and water basketball and volleyball. The Cilantro restaurant is excellent and the O Grille was good. I would order room service for dinner, included in The Level, over the Marketplace. I didn't eat at the other restaurants. Read the Eco placard for info on new towels and linens for each day. Majestic Tours has a desk in the lobby to help book excursions during your stay. I recommend booking dinner reservations early as they fill up fast

posts.text: Our experience here was alright, the hotel is nice and clean, but what really turned us off was the staff. We stayed for 4 days and they were always kind of rude, moved really slowly, and always had some attitude (especially the hosts of the restaurants). One day they cleaned our room, however left no water bottles nor clean towels for us to use. We called the front desk and guest services about 3 times after waiting 30 minutes each time we called. We had just gotten back from an excursion and had to get ready for dinner, and we had to wait close to 2 hours to get our towels. Other than the staff, everything else was okay. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family, if they didn't mind having to wait long to get seated at a restaurant or to get room amenities.

thread.title: Secure Your Family By Selecting Life Insurance
thread.title_full: Secure Your Family By Selecting Life Insurance

posts.author: yardscrew38kathy
posts.title: Secure Your Family By Selecting Life Insurance
posts.text:
When it comes time for you to get a life insurance policy, you may wonder where to begin, as there are so many things to consider when purchasing a plan that works for you and your family. The tips in this article can provide you with what you need to know, in order to choose a good life insurance policy.
When shopping for life insurance, be sure to know the differences between the two main types: term life and permanent. Term life is a chosen amount of years that your benefactors are eligible to receive your insurance money. If you outlive these years, then the plan is void. Permanent life insurance stays with you until you die, but rates will generally be higher.
Save money on your policy by cleaning up your bad habits and improving your health. Your policy will be priced based upon your risk class, which is determined by many different health factors. Losing excess weight, quitting smoking and getting your cholesterol in check, will reduce your premiums.
A person should not wait until they are sick to consider life insurance. Many preexisting conditions can make you ineligible for a life insurance policy. If you are eligible, premiums will likely be higher than they would be for a healthy individual. Taking out a policy while you’re healthy is the best way to protect yourself, and your family.
Having a life insurance policy can be a nice way to leave money for the family that you are leaving behind. why not try this out can help out greatly to assist your family’s needs. The right life insurance policy can give an individual a wonderful peace of mind, knowing that his or her family is going to be okay, financially.
If you’re naming someone close to you as a beneficiary of your policy, make sure you inform them of it so that they’re ready to act when you pass. This kind of news thrust on people after you’re gone is not good for anyone. Make sure http://www.14news.com/story/36936727/news bring it to their attention while you still can.
Premiums can vary up to 40 percent between companies. There are websites that offer comparative quotes from a range of companies. You want to use one, though, that includes medical information when figuring quotes for you.
Your broker should be able to knowledgeably answer these difficult questions. You will want to ask if you can renew the policy, cancel the policy, or any questions concerning premium guarantees. Asking these specific questions will help you find the best policy.
A lot of people with no dependents believe that they do not need life insurance. Well, someone has to bury you. You have some family or friends somewhere, and you probably do not want to burden them financially on top of grief. Even if it’s a small policy, it’s better than purchasing nothing at all.
Look at the rating for the life insurance company that you are interested in purchasing from. You may be wasting your money if you do not get a policy from a company with a secure background. You want to find a business with at least an “A” rating.

go to this website should think about life insurance even if you do not earn any income. For instance, if you are a stay-at-home mom, subscribing to life insurance guarantees you that your family will be able to hire someone to take care of the housekeeping and also look after your children while your husband keeps working.
To save money on your life insurance, make adjustments to your policy as your needs grow and change. Good times to reevaluate your policy are after getting married or divorced, after having a child or after gaining care-taking responsibilities for an elderly parent or relative. If you have saved enough for retirement and have no one else to take care of, you can forgo life insurance entirely.
Look over your life insurance policy each year. Every time you experience a major life event, there is a possibility that something in the plan will need to be changed. For example, if you have a baby, you may need to increase your policy so that your family will have what they need if you should die.
Do not buy an accidental death policy in addition to your regular policy. This is a sign that you are dealing with a company that puts their needs before yours. Find a company that will pay out any claims regardless of whether the death was accidental or of natural causes.
If you are not wanting to turn your life insurance into an investment, then term life insurance might be your best option. Term life insurance does not accumulate any cash value; instead, it is a fixed payout available upon death only, set by a fixed premium price each month. This type of insurance is what you are looking for if you want basic life insurance.
The question of when to buy life insurance is frequently asked. Since the purpose of life insurance is to replace your income in the situation that you die, you should purchase insurance when you have dependents. The type and kind of life insurance will depend on your specific situation and how much money you will need to ensure that your dependents are taken care of.
It can be trying to listen to so-called experts give you their opinion on life insurance. The information in this article has been widely proven to be useful, time and time again. Hopefully this article will help to either clear up what you were unsure about, or give you some new information that you can act upon to get the cover that you need.

posts.author: expedia.com
posts.text: We got to Melia and were greeted immediately by the staff who showed us where to check in. Check in process took about 10 minutes, we chose the All inclusive route so we got a bracelet that stated that to the staff members and received a $400 credit booklet. You have to make reservations for the restaurants in Melia (you are given 2 days ahead to book). That reservation desk is open from 9am - 5 pm i believe. Black Angus is not apart of the All Inclusive deals. If you are hungry and it is after 11pm (when room service closes) you can head down to the tapas bar where they will be serving a small, yet delicious menu until 3am. There was always something fun to do in the lobby area at night and during the day (dancing, music, comedy show, games). The hotel did not offer food services on the beach, but they did offer drinks! We used our $150 room upgrade from the $400 credit booklet and used it to get the oceanview room (SO WORTH!). The view was so pretty and you can hear the ocean and music. At night it is not loud or anything! The hotel room was very clean and the staff comes by to make the bed and restock the mini fridge for you during the day (usually while everyone is away at the beach). There is a safe in the room and they also had coffee maker. If you get bored just relaxing you can take the FREE shuttle bus to Baha Mar they have casino and restaurants there. I would recommend this place!

thread.title: Why Jordan Henderson has got a battle on his hands at Liverpool - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Why Jordan Henderson has got a battle on his hands at Liverpool - Mirror Online

posts.author: Andy Kelly
posts.title: Why Jordan Henderson has got a battle on his hands at Liverpool - Mirror Online
posts.text:
Why Jordan Henderson has got a battle on his hands at Liverpool The England midfielder did not even come as a substitute during the 7-0 win against Spartak Moscow
 Share Comments By Andy Kelly 08:53, 7 DEC 2017 Sport Video Liverpool FC updates Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson was fully fit but did not start Liverpool's key Champions League clash with Spartak Moscow.
The England midfielder did not even come as a substitute during the 7-0 win, and Andy Kelly of the Liverpool Ehco feels Henderson now has a huge fight on his hands.
A big call.
Make no mistake, Jordan Henderson will have been very disappointed not to start this game.
He's the club captain and, regardless of issues of rotation, when the big games come along he'd expect to play.
This was Liverpool's biggest game of the season and he had to settle for the bench.
It may have ended up a rout but it's not what Jurgen Klopp can have been expecting before the match.
Jordan Henderson did not even get off the bench against Spartak Moscow (Image: Action Images via Reuters) Explaining his decision before kick-off, Klopp said: “I have a lot of difficult decisions – good decisions to make in the moment – so this is the line-up for tonight and that’s all.
“Hendo and Millie played in these positions at Brighton. It is quite intense in these positions, so that’s why I decided to do this.”
None of that is untrue but this was felt like a statement selection from the manager.
"Can you imagine Gerrard being left out in such a game?" was a regular reaction as the news filtered through.
Liverpool were so dominant in a 7-0 win that could have been double that, it's difficult to argue that Henderson instead of Emre Can would not have resulted in just as significant a victory.
Henderson is Liverpool's captain - but is he really a first choice central midfielder? (Image: Getty) But with Can still debating where his future lies, perhaps Klopp wanted to remind his German compatriot that he is at the heart of big Liverpool games now - and can be in the future.
Henderson has of course been at the centre of perhaps some of the most heated debates among supporters this season.
For some, collapses like the second half at Sevilla have been placed firmly at the door of the team captain. Others see the arrival of Naby Keita at the end of the year - Leipzig didn't make the last 16 by the way - as spelling the end for his life as first choice in a Liverpool team.
If so, this selection may be seen by some as "the beginning of the end".
Jurgen Klopp celebrates last night's win (Image: Action Images via Reuters) That however remains unlikely and Klopp was keen to play down his omission after the game.
"I could have made three or four different line-ups in midfield alone. If Alberto (Moreno) is out for a few games, I don't know, so of course we have Robbo (Andy Robertson) and Millie, that's all good.
"But we need the players, all of them, we need freshness.
"I can imagine that someone tomorrow will make a story that Jordan Henderson the captain was not involved.
"I have to make hard decisions. Tonight it was like this, it was nothing. Hendo will play the next game (Merseyside derby) 100 per cent. He could have started tonight but we had to make a decision and that's what we did.
Naby Keita is joining Liverpool in the summer (Image: 2017 Getty Images) "When it works then everything is good and if not you write it the other way around, that'd how life is."
Henderson in his Skipper's Notes in the programme spoke about that battle for places at Anfield.
"The competition for places in our team is really strong at the moment and it's going to be vitally important we keep it that way over the coming weeks and months if we're to keep winning," he said.
Jordan Henderson isn't one to walk away from a battle, but one thing is for sure, he's got one on his hands.

thread.title: New European Tech Startup LivingPackets Launches Pilot International Delivery Service, Collaborates with London's St Pancras Renaissance Hotel
thread.title_full: New European Tech Startup LivingPackets Launches Pilot International Delivery Service, Collaborates with London's St Pancras Renaissance Hotel - PR.com

posts.author: PR.com
posts.title: New European Tech Startup LivingPackets Launches Pilot International Delivery Service, Collaborates with London's St Pancras Renaissance Hotel
posts.text:
New European Tech Startup LivingPackets Launches Pilot International Delivery Service, Collaborates with London's St Pancras Renaissance Hotel
New Delivery Concept Promises to Shake Up the European Express Delivery Industry
London, United Kingdom, A game-changing international delivery startup, LivingPackets has secured support of the five-star St Pancras Renaissance Hotel, part of Marriott International Inc, for the launch of its pilot express delivery service between London and Paris.
Cooperation with Marriott’s iconic hospitality brand marks a major breakthrough for the new European tech start-up, which uses existing traveller trips to deliver parcels within Europe in just a few hours, avoiding storage and transport-related costs as well as harmful CO2 emissions. It also recognises the growing need for the USD 150bn-worth global express delivery industry to be more efficient.
How It Works
LivingPackets uses a concept, which is still very new in the logistics & delivery industry, but is seen by its founders as the most obvious solution in the age of the Sharing Economy and P2P (peer-to-peer) services. It harnesses individual traveller networks and its patented “intelligent” bags (featuring a camera, shock and temperature sensors, real-time tracking, electronic lock and Bluetooth) without compromising a delivery’s safety and security. A sender books a delivery via the LivingPackets mobile app, and deposits the item himself or asks for a pick up. The item is then delivered to a designated point near the international train terminal at Kings Cross St Pancras and is placed in a secure bag by the LivingPackets security operators (called “the Guardians”). A traveller participating in the LivingPackets network is automatically notified and will pick up the bag on his way to the platform. The process is fully automated and takes just a few hours from the pick-up to delivery.
A New Model: Profit-Sharing
Additionally, the LivingPackets’ profit sharing business model is in itself a novelty in the world of startup fundraising practices: the investors who support the business via crowdfunding receive 50% of the profits. To date, the startup has raised EUR 80k.
“We are very happy to be working with LivingPackets, whose innovative delivery model will now allow us to offer a Premium service to all our clients to deliver their belongings to Paris in just a few hours and at a reasonable price,” said Salvatore Bartolone, Head Concierge at St Pancras Renaissance.
“We are proud to be a trusted partner of St Pancras Renaissance Hotel, an iconic luxury brand in the European hospitality industry, and we are close to reaching agreements with other top-market industry names. We also see a huge demand for fast, affordable and reliable deliveries from online retailers and luxury brands. With no existing alternative to the established and aging international logistics practices, there is a lot of room for young and disruptive ‘sharing economy’ players like LivingPackets to step in,” said Marie Le Page, LivingPackets CEO in the UK.
About LivingPackets
LivingPackets is a European tech startup that is looking to improve and change the world of express deliveries. It offers the fastest, most reliable and most affordable international delivery services to date, using individual traveller’s networks and its unique patented traceable bags. LivingPackets contributes to a greener and fairer world thanks to its unique profit-sharing model, smart technology and its environment- friendly approach. Established in 2016, LivingPackets is headquartered in Switzerland with offices in France, London, and Germany. See more at www.livingpackets.com
About St Pancras Renaissance Hotel
St Pancras Renaissance Hotel is located in King’s Cross, one of London's most exciting neighborhoods offering excellent transport links and a wealth of bars, restaurants, museums and galleries. The 245 room hotel incorporates 38 historical Chambers suites and the exclusive Chambers Club. There are a range of dining options including the Booking Office bar and restaurant, Hansom Lounge, MI + ME and The Gilbert Scott restaurant, managed by renowned British Chef, Marcus Wareing. The hotel also boasts a Spa and 10 unique meeting and event spaces. Combining stunning architecture and an exceptional level of service, the hotel offers an experience like no other. See more at www.stpancraslondon.com
Editor’s Notes:
- A LivingPackets logo and photo of CEO Marie le Page are available upon request
- Get in touch for a demo of the LivingPackets transport model, its secure bag, and an interview with the CEO
- St Pancras Renaissance will initially use the LivingPackets service in order to return lost and left-behind items to hotel guests quickly and securely
- LivingPackets are currently talking to major transport and logistics companies about potential cooperation, and are soon planning to add Brussels, Düsseldorf, Lille, Lyon, Marseille to their European destinations. The operations will initially focus on Western Europe
Press Contact
Yulianna Vilkos
yulianna.vilkos@gmail.com
07726452757 (mob)

posts.title: VFS Global expands Cyprus visa application centre to 16 Indian cities
posts.text: Facebook VFS Global expands Cyprus visa application centre to 16 Indian cities Expanding the network of Cyprus visa application centres in India, VFS Global has launched four new centres in Thiruvananthapuram, Goa, Gurugram and Jaipur, taking the Cyprus VFS centre toll 16 Indian cities. The recent launch in Thiruvananthapuram was inaugurated by Demetrios A Theophylactou, High Commissioner of Cyprus to India. Speaking at the event, he said, “The opening is quite timely, also due to a noticeable increase in visa related queries from Kerala. The centre would work in close cooperation with the Consular Department of the High Commission to achieve the goal of timely and efficient issuance of visas.” Vinay Malhotra, Chief Operating Officer-Middle East and South Asia, VFS Global, said, “Cyprus is fast emerging as a popular destination of choice for leisure and business travellers from India, due to its abundant natural beauty and historical heritage. We are proud and committed to expanding the network of Cyprus visa application centres across the South Asia region as a whole, with more centres planned in Nepal, Sri Lanka, and Bangladesh in the coming months.” Post navigation

thread.title: Australian deep sea cable cut - internet at a crawl
thread.title_full: Australian deep sea cable cut - internet at a crawl

posts.author: The Diamond Dude (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: Australian deep sea cable cut - internet at a crawl
posts.text:
Australia's internet is set to suffer again after undersea cable was cut on Sunday The SEA-ME-WE3 cable linking Perth and Singapore was repaired six weeks ago There is no estimate for when it will be fixed, but previous repairs took 50 days While the cable is offline internet traffic to Asia will need be rerouted via the US An undersea internet cable linking Australia with Asia has been cut, just six weeks after being repaired. The 39,000 kilometre SEA-ME-WE3 cable linking Perth and Singapore took 50 days to fix after suffering multiple cuts in August. Internet users are now facing the prospect of slow speeds for weeks, and no time-frame has been given for when repairs might be completed. 

Source -  http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-5146795/Aussie-internet-slows-crawl-undersea-cable-cut.html

thread.title: Resistance analysis of Epclusa shows patients may retreat with sofosbuvir
thread.title_full: Resistance analysis of Epclusa shows patients may retreat with sofosbuvir

posts.author: TBD
posts.title: Resistance analysis of Epclusa shows patients may retreat with sofosbuvir
posts.text:
Hézode C, et al. J Hepatol . 2017;doi:10.1016/j.jhep.2017.11.032. December 6, 2017 
Treatment with Epclusa for 12 weeks resulted in high sustained virologic response rates among patients with hepatitis C genotypes 1 through 6, irrespective of baseline NS5A resistance-associated substitutions, according to recently published data. 
The researchers detected NS5A inhibitor resistance, but not resistance to sofosbuvir, in the few patients who did not achieve SVR. 
“Treatment with [Epclusa] for 12 weeks was effective across highly diverse HCV subtypes,” Christophe H é zode, MD, PhD, from the Université Paris-Est, France, and colleagues wrote. “Most of the few patients who experienced virologic failure after treatment with [Epclusa] for 12 weeks had single class resistance to NS5A inhibitor velpatasvir, but not to the NS5B inhibitor sofosbuvir allowing for a possible retreatment with sofosbuvir-containing regimens.” 
The researchers conducted resistance analyses of six phase 3 clinical trials of Epclusa (sofosbuvir/velpatasvir, Gilead Sciences) for 12 weeks in a total of 1,778 patients with chronic HCV genotypes 1 through 6. Trials included the ASTRAL 1, 2, 3 and 5 studies and POLARIS-2 and POLARIS-3 studies. 
The overall SVR across the studies was 98.9%. The SVR rates by genotype were 99% for genotype 1, 100% for genotype 2, 97.5% for genotype 3, 99.5% for genotype 4, and 100% for genotypes 5 and 6. 
The overall prevalence of NS5A RASs was 28% in patients with available NS5A sequencing data (n = 1773). The lowest prevalence was 9% in patients with genotype 5 and the highest prevalence was 61% among patients with genotype 2. 
Among patients with genotypes 1a, 1b, 2, 4, 5 or 6, the presence of NS5A RASs at baseline had no impact on SVR rate. 
Twelve percent of patients with genotype 3 had NS5A RASs at baseline. Compared with those without NS5A RASs at baseline, patients with genotype 3 and NS5A RASs had a lower SVR rate at 12 weeks (93% vs. 98%). 
Prevalence of baseline NS5A velpatasvir-specific RASs among the whole cohort was 8% (n = 138) with the lowest prevalence in patients with genotype 5 (0%) and the highest prevalence among patients with genotype 6 (52%). 
“The lower prevalence of NS5A velpatasvir-specific RAS compared to NS5A class RASs is due to the improved resistance barrier of velpatasvir,” according to the researchers. The SVR rates for patients with genotypes 1 through 6 and velpatasvir-specific RASs ranged from 93% to 100% compared with 98% to 100% in patients without velpatasvir-specific RASs. 
Twenty of the 1,778 patients treated with sofosbuvir/velpatasvir for 12 weeks did not achieve SVR. Of those, seven had HCV genotype 1, 12 had genotype 3, and one had genotype 4. – by Talitha Bennett 
Disclosure: Hézode reports he served as a clinical investigator and speaker or consultant for AbbVie, Boehringer Ingelheim, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Gilead Sciences, Merck Sharp & Dohme and Roche. Please see the full study for the other researchers’ relevant financial disclosures.

Among patients with genotypes 1a, 1b, 2, 4, 5 or 6, the presence of NS5A RASs at baseline had no impact on SVR rate. 
Twelve percent of patients with genotype 3 had NS5A RASs at baseline. Compared with those without NS5A RASs at baseline, patients with genotype 3 and NS5A RASs had a lower SVR rate at 12 weeks (93% vs. 98%). 
Prevalence of baseline NS5A velpatasvir-specific RASs among the whole cohort was 8% (n = 138) with the lowest prevalence in patients with genotype 5 (0%) and the highest prevalence among patients with genotype 6 (52%). 
“The lower prevalence of NS5A velpatasvir-specific RAS compared to NS5A class RASs is due to the improved resistance barrier of velpatasvir,” according to the researchers. The SVR rates for patients with genotypes 1 through 6 and velpatasvir-specific RASs ranged from 93% to 100% compared with 98% to 100% in patients without velpatasvir-specific RASs. 
Twenty of the 1,778 patients treated with sofosbuvir/velpatasvir for 12 weeks did not achieve SVR. Of those, seven had HCV genotype 1, 12 had genotype 3, and one had genotype 4. – by Talitha Bennett 
Disclosure: Hézode reports he served as a clinical investigator and speaker or consultant for AbbVie, Boehringer Ingelheim, Bristol-Myers Squibb, Gilead Sciences, Merck Sharp & Dohme and Roche. Please see the full study for the other researchers’ relevant financial disclosures. Read Next

posts.author: Lauren Beukes
posts.title: Red-Billed Queleas make their appearance
posts.text:
Red-Billed Queleas make their appearance Red Billed Queleas are indigenous to most parts of Southern Africa. 12 hours ago 
By Warren Dick 
Some folks have noticed some rather strange looking sparrows at their bird feeders over the past few weeks; however these are not sparrows at all but are rather Red Billed Queleas. 
After a recent post that I put onto Facebook about these in my garden a lot of other folks right around Durban have also noticed these birds in their gardens in just the past two months. Website 
Red Billed Queleas are indigenous to most parts of Southern Africa, however they are migratory birds within their range. The main reason for their migrations is for food. In many parts these birds can fly in huge flocks consisting of many thousands of individuals. Because of this and the fact that they can do large scale damage to grain crops they are often seen as a pest and have earned a nickname of “Feathered Locusts”. Sadly in many areas these birds are even poisoned with pesticide to try control their numbers. 
However in our urban gardens they are a welcome burst of colour, cute chirps and lively activity. Every afternoon my neighbours put seeds out for the birds and I get to watch around 50 of these Sparrow sized birds playing in their tree. Let’s enjoy these little birdies for as long as they choose to visit our gardens. SHARE

thread.title: NZ shares up, Fletcher and Spark gain
thread.title_full: NZ shares up, Fletcher and Spark gain

posts.author: Sophie Boot
posts.title: NZ shares up, Fletcher and Spark gain
posts.text:
NZ shares up, Fletcher and Spark gain Sophie Boot X 
New Zealand shares rose on Thursday, led higher by Fletcher Building and Spark, while A2 Milk Co and Kathmandu Holdings weakened. 
The S&P/NZX50 Index gained 41.74 points, or 0.5 per cent, to 8172.6. Within the index, 24 stocks rose, 14 fell and 12 were unchanged. Turnover was $145 million. 
"Offshore markets didn't give us too much of a lead last night, and the market is probably just recovering from the first three days of the week, which have been pretty poor," said Grant Williamson, director at Hamilton Hindin Greene. 
"The closer we get to Christmas the more the volumes will continue to fall back." 
Fletcher Building led the index, up 3.2 per cent to $7.01. 
"There has been a lot of interest focussed on Fletcher Building for no particular reason but its oversold position - it has bounced back up on bargain hunting," Mr Williamson said. 
Spark rose 2.5 per cent to $3.64 and Air New Zealand gained 2.1 per cent to $3.225. 
Kathmandu Holdings was the worst performer, down 2.1 per cent to $2.34. 
A2 Milk Co dropped 1.9 per cent to $7.93. It has settled a court case in Australia with its rival Lion Group. 
"That share price has got a mind of its own, the news didn't have too much of a bearing on the stock at all." 
Z Energy dropped 0.8 per cent to $7.62. On Wednesday, the government said it would investigate fuel prices and is looking to increase the Commerce Commission's market studies powers by the end of next year. 
"There's been a lot in the media and it has got one or two investors a little bit nervous." 
Trustpower dipped 0.5 per cent to $5.95. It is eyeing up King Country Energy's retail business as it teams up with King Country Electric Power Trust to buy out the remaining minority shareholders. 
Outside the benchmark index, Tegel Group fell 3.3 per cent to $1.18 and Opus was unchanged at $1.81. It will de-list from the NZX in January after being acquired by Canadian firm WSP Global.

posts.author: MICHAEL BUCKMASTER News-Gazette Correspondent
posts.title: UCI officials taking drug fight to new level, pass ordinance on drug nuisance evictions
posts.text:
UCI officials taking drug fight to new level, pass ordinance on drug nuisance evictions By MICHAEL BUCKMASTER News-Gazette Correspondent Dec 5, 2017 Save 
Individuals selling, manufacturing or using drugs in rental properties in Union City, Ind., now face more potential problems than just those provided by Indiana statutes. 
City council members last week unanimously approved the second and final reading of an ordinance regarding drug nuisance evictions. The ordinance, which is patterned after a similar law in Richmond, has been strongly supported by Mayor Bryan Conklin and Police Chief Cobie Wells. 
Wells, who also serves as the city public safety director, said this ordinance will be another valuable tool in battling drugs. 
“I’m excited about the drug nuisance ordinance,” Wells enthused. “It’s giving law enforcement and the city a chance to work with the landlords. That ordinance meets the goal of evicting these individuals (drug offenders).” 
The ordinance itself also clearly states its intention: The sale and use of illegal drugs is a serious problem in the Union City community; the city of Union City desires to stop the sale and use of illegal drugs within the community; and it is thus desirable to eliminate the repeated sale and use of illegal drugs from any given location. 
Under this section of Union City code, the use of non-owner occupied real property to commit an act constituting an offense under Indiana code shall be deemed a civil nuisance. 
The ordinance states that no owner of real estate located in the city shall knowingly allow it to be used in such a manner to constitute a civil nuisance. An owner of such real estate is deemed to have knowledge of such activity upon receipt of notice. 
Upon notice of any report or complaint of such suspected activity, the Union City Police Dept. shall conduct such investigation as it deems necessary. At any time prior to or during this investigation, the department shall, when deemed appropriate under the circumstances, send an initial warning letter to the owner and/or occupant to the property that it suspects such activity may be occurring and that an investigation is about to commence or is ongoing. 
The ordinance also is intended to as sist landlords with evicting these drug offenders. The chief of police shall use reasonable efforts to train, educate and assist real estate owners in evicting, as well as avoiding the placement of tenants in their real estate who are known violators. 
RENTAL PROPERTY STANDARDS 
Wells also spoke in support of an ordinance governing rental property standards, which was approved on first reading. 
“I’m ready for an ordinance like this,” the chief elaborated. “I think we need to take a stronger stance on some of the properties out there. We need this. We’re looking forward to this. It will help us, and it will help Union City. To sell Union City and get businesses in here, we have to do this.” 
That ordinance will be considered on second and final reading at the next city council meeting. 
TRASH REMOVAL RATE INCREASES 
Council members also approved the first reading of an ordinance amending trash removal rates from the current $11 per month to $12.50 per month. It was noted that the city has been paying BestWay more than $11 per household, per month for the past two years. 
GRANT APPLICATION UPDATE 
City manager Monte Poling reported on the progress of some grant applications and projects. 
“We’re getting the engineering done on some of the Stellar projects,” Poling said. 
Such projects included the downtown streetscape phase II, the Plum Street sidewalk project and the trail from Columbia Street to Harter Park. 
PRAISE FOR LIGHT DISPLAY 
The mayor and council members also praised the efforts of council member Chad Spence and others involved with the Christmas light displays at Harter Park. 
The next Union City, Ind., council meeting will be 6 p.m. Monday in council chambers. This article originally ran on winchesternewsgazette.com .

posts.title: Taylor Swift - new music & album "Reputation" (November 10, 2017)* | Page 31
posts.text:
Bevok said: ↑ Like one or two others I think it rewards repeated listening. Although perhaps there aren't so many of those pop hits that jump out and hit you in the face the first time you hear them on the radio, there are some superb melodies and sounds. Don't Blame Me for example in the first half is worth investigating further. Those latter songs like Gorgeous, Getaway Car, Call It and New Years are surefire great songs to my ear.
Been great to see it confound the pundits who bemoaned the performance of the promo singles and predicted a flop - biggest album of the year and biggest sales week of Taylor's career. I think making people buy it is a good strategy - I know personally I've given it much more listening than I would have if it had just appeared as another new album on a streaming platform. Click to expand... I'm of two minds about the sales of this album. On one hand, I think this is a relative disappointment insofar as she was much bigger in November of 2017 than she was at the time of 1989 's release in 2014 and there wasn't any competition in her way. On the other hand, it's amazing that she basically replicated 1989 's initial numbers with much weaker singles and less promotion. Obviously, it's a huge success relative to the rest of the market. I'm curious to see how much worse the legs are on this one compared to 1989 and how she approaches the next album.
